means: 意外发现珍奇事物的才能

word_mean: 奇遇发现：非原探索目的而系偶然的灵感所致的意外重大的科学发现

sentence.Network_en: Some of the best effects in my garden have been the result of serendipity.
sentence.Network_cn: 我园子里最珍贵的几件物品是机缘巧合之下意外所得。

sentence.Network_en: " It was serendipity all the way, " he says.
sentence.Network_cn: 用他的话说是 “ 一直都很走运 ”.

sentence.Network_en: Chiefly, it creates much more room for coincidence and serendipity.
sentence.Network_cn: 首先, 凌乱无章为偶发事件及易遇奇缘创造了更多机会.

这种个性化推荐的想法与谷歌“巧遇引擎”(serendipity engine)的理念不谋而合，该公司副总裁玛丽莎·梅耶尔(Marissa Mayer)曾提及这 …
举例来说，谷歌可推出了一款“奇缘引擎”(serendipity engine)，如果某位用户喜欢的作家出了新书，该搜索引擎就会向用户发送提醒信 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: 1754: coined by Horace Walpole, suggested by The Three Princes of Serendip, the title of a fairy tale in which the heroes ‘were always making discoveries, by accidents and sagacity, of things they were not in quest of’

entry.tran: (意外发现或发明新奇或有价值事物的)运气,走运,机缘凑巧
entry.def: Serendipity is the luck some people have in finding or creating interesting or valuable things by chance.

example.ex: Some of the best effects in my garden have been the result of serendipity.
example.tran: 我园子里最珍贵的几件物品是机缘巧合之下意外所得。

means.word_mean: 1. good luck in making unexpected and fortunate discoveries
